item.title: Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective gives new life to a Nintendo DS cult classic | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Capcom via Polygon A bittersweet remaster Ghost Trick follows Sissel, a recently deceased spirit who can‚Äôt remember who he is or how he died. But he can possess objects, setting up the game‚Äôs...
item.content:encoded: Image: Capcom via Polygon A bittersweet remaster Ghost Trick follows Sissel, a recently deceased spirit who can‚Äôt remember who he is or how he died. But he can possess objects, setting up the game‚Äôs mechanical core: interfering in the Rube Goldberg-like puzzles to save others from their own grisly fates. The game alternates between these puzzle sections and dialogue-heavy story segments, where a twisty plot unfolds in sweet and surprising and surprisingly sweet ways. Originally released for...

item.title: LG‚Äôs $599.99 A2 OLED TV is the best July 4 deal | Polygon - Gaming

item.content:encoded: Our weekly gaming and entertainment deal roundup is here It‚Äôs the weekend again, but not just any weekend. In the U.S. it‚Äôs about to be Independence Day on July 4, so we‚Äôre taking this opportunity to pack a little more into this post than we typically do. Not only will we be catching you up on this week‚Äôs best gaming and entertainment deals (plus what products other Polygon readers are buying), we‚Äôre also going to weave in some great July 4 deals that won‚Äôt last long. But don‚Äôt fret too much if...

item.description: Pikmin 4 launches July 21 on Nintendo Switch | Image: Nintendo Pikmin 4 leads a light month, but it‚Äôs not the only highlight July is traditionally a slow month for new, major video game releases, bu...
item.content:encoded: Pikmin 4 launches July 21 on Nintendo Switch | Image: Nintendo Pikmin 4 leads a light month, but it‚Äôs not the only highlight July is traditionally a slow month for new, major video game releases, but it‚Äôs not a complete desert. It‚Äôs just very genre-heavy. Spread across the midsummer month, players should find something to pique their interest, if they‚Äôre not still sunk deep into May and June‚Äôs mammoth launches. The highlights include Capcom‚Äôs return to dino shooters, Exoprimal; Nintendo‚Äôs mirt...

item.title: How to Build a Streaming Semi-structured Analytics Platform on Snowflake | KDnuggets
item.description: Building a datalake for semi-structured data or json has always been challenging. Imagine if the json documents are streaming or continuously flowing from healthcare vendors then we need a robust mode...
item.content:encoded: Building a datalake for semi-structured data or json has always been challenging. Imagine if the json documents are streaming or continuously flowing from healthcare vendors then we need a robust modern architecture that can deal with such a high volume. At the same time analytics layer also needs to be created so as to generate value from it.

item.title: Tokyo Highway is a tense board game about building roads | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Polygon An automative Jenga-like If you could design your own highway system ‚Äî well, it wouldn‚Äôt look anything like what you get from Tokyo Highway. This tabletop game, loosely based on Japan...
item.content:encoded: Image: Polygon An automative Jenga-like If you could design your own highway system ‚Äî well, it wouldn‚Äôt look anything like what you get from Tokyo Highway. This tabletop game, loosely based on Japan‚Äôs actual privatized expressways, asks players to build their own roads from sticks and pylons. For a modern board game, Tokyo Highway looks gorgeously minimalist, even bordering on simple, but the gameplay is surprisingly tense. Rather than prizing efficiency, the game awards you points for crossin...

item.title: AEW: Fight Forever recaptures the attitude of golden-age wrestling games | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Yuke‚Äôs/THQ Nordic A faithful homage and a promising start Ask most wrestling fans, and they‚Äôll mention the late ‚Äô90s and early 2000s as the best era, both for the in-ring product and the coll...
item.content:encoded: Image: Yuke‚Äôs/THQ Nordic A faithful homage and a promising start Ask most wrestling fans, and they‚Äôll mention the late ‚Äô90s and early 2000s as the best era, both for the in-ring product and the collection of video games that were released for Nintendo 64 and PlayStation. Games like WWF No Mercy, WCW/nWo Revenge, and the early SmackDown! series were easy to learn but difficult to master. Almost 25 years later, All Elite Wrestling is looking to capture that ease of use and nostalgia with AEW: Fi...

item.description: Jon Bennett and I have just uploaded to the arXiv our paper ‚ÄúAdjoint Brascamp-Lieb inequalities‚Äú. In this paper, we observe that the family of multilinear inequalities known as the Brascamp-Lieb inequ...
item.content:encoded: Jon Bennett and I have just uploaded to the arXiv our paper ‚ÄúAdjoint Brascamp-Lieb inequalities‚Äú. In this paper, we observe that the family of multilinear inequalities known as the Brascamp-Lieb inequalities (or Holder-Brascamp-Lieb inequalities) admit an adjoint formulation, and explore the theory of these adjoint inequalities and some of their consequences. To motivate matters let [‚Ä¶]

item.content:encoded: Posted by Fabian Pedregosa and Eleni Triantafillou, Research Scientists, Google Deep learning has recently driven tremendous progress in a wide array of applications, ranging from realistic image generation and impressive retrieval systems to language models that can hold human-like conversations. While this progress is very exciting, the widespread use of deep neural network models requires caution: as guided by Google‚Äôs AI Principles, we seek to develop AI technologies responsibly by unde...

item.description: Posted by Yang Zhao and Tingbo Hou, Software Engineers, Core ML In recent years, diffusion models have shown great success in text-to-image generation, achieving high image quality, improved infer...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Yang Zhao and Tingbo Hou, Software Engineers, Core ML In recent years, diffusion models have shown great success in text-to-image generation, achieving high image quality, improved inference performance, and expanding our creative inspiration. Nevertheless, it is still challenging to efficiently control the generation, especially with conditions that are difficult to describe with text. item.description: Posted by Kuniaki Saito, Student Researcher, Cloud AI Team, and Kihyuk Sohn, Research Scientist, Perception Team Pre-training visual language (VL) models on web-scale image-caption datasets has re...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Kuniaki Saito, Student Researcher, Cloud AI Team, and Kihyuk Sohn, Research Scientist, Perception Team Pre-training visual language (VL) models on web-scale image-caption datasets has recently emerged as a powerful alternative to traditional pre-training on image classification data. Image-caption datasets are considered to be more ‚Äúopen-domain‚Äù because they contain broader scene types and vocabulary words, which result in models with strong performance in few- and zero-shot recogn...

item.description: The k-Nearest Neighbors Classifier is a machine learning algorithm that assigns a new data point to the most common class among its k closest neighbors. In this tutorial, you will learn the basic step...
item.content:encoded: The k-Nearest Neighbors Classifier is a machine learning algorithm that assigns a new data point to the most common class among its k closest neighbors. In this tutorial, you will learn the basic steps of building and applying this classifier in Python.

The article comes from both a business and technical perspective, owing to the persona of the authors.

item.description: Have you ever wondered how fortune tellers, astrologers, or our well-known Baba Vanga used to predict future events? Or have you ever questioned whether AI and ML have the capabilities to predict futu...
item.content:encoded: Have you ever wondered how fortune tellers, astrologers, or our well-known Baba Vanga used to predict future events? Or have you ever questioned whether AI and ML have the capabilities to predict future events as Baba Vanga did? For suppose if AI and ML have the capabilities, then up to how extent can it predict? I am writing this to give answers to these types of questions.

item.description: Posted by Ramki Gummadi, Software Engineer, Google and Kevin Chen, Software Engineer, YouTube Caching is a ubiquitous idea in computer science that significantly improves the performance of stora...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Ramki Gummadi, Software Engineer, Google and Kevin Chen, Software Engineer, YouTube Caching is a ubiquitous idea in computer science that significantly improves the performance of storage and retrieval systems by storing a subset of popular items closer to the client based on request patterns. An important algorithmic piece of cache management is the decision policy used for dynamically updating the set of items being stored, which has been extensively optimized over several decad...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Zal√°n Borsos, Research Software Engineer, and Marco Tagliasacchi, Senior Staff Research Scientist, Google Research The recent progress in generative AI unlocked the possibility of creating new content in several different domains, including text, vision and audio. These models often rely on the fact that raw data is first converted to a compressed format as a sequence of tokens. In the case of audio, neural audio codecs (e.g., SoundStream or EnCodec) can efficiently compress wav...

Our mission is to demonstrate AI‚Äôs societal benefit by enabling real-world value, with projects spanning work in public health, accessibility, crisis response, climate and energy, and nature and society. We believe that the best way to drive positive change in ...

item.title: The world‚Äôs first braiding of non-Abelian anyons | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Trond Andersen and Yuri Lensky, Research Scientists, Google Quantum AI Team Imagine you‚Äôre shown two identical objects and then asked to close your eyes. When you open your eyes, you see the...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Trond Andersen and Yuri Lensky, Research Scientists, Google Quantum AI Team Imagine you‚Äôre shown two identical objects and then asked to close your eyes. When you open your eyes, you see the same two objects in the same position. How can you determine if they have been swapped back and forth? Intuition and the laws of quantum mechanics agree: If the objects are truly identical, there is no way to tell. While this sounds like common sense, it only applies to our familiar three-dimension...

item.description: The Salem prize was established in 1968 and named in honor of Rapha√´l Salem (1898-1963), a mathematician famous notably for his deep study of the links between Fourier series and number theory and for...
item.content:encoded: The Salem prize was established in 1968 and named in honor of Rapha√´l Salem (1898-1963), a mathematician famous notably for his deep study of the links between Fourier series and number theory and for pioneering applications of probabilistic methods to these fields. It was largely administered by Jean Bourgain until his untimely death in 2018; [‚Ä¶]

item.content:encoded: Orca is a 13B parameter model that learns to imitate the reasoning processes of LFMs. It uses progressive learning and teacher assistance from ChatGPT to overcome capacity gaps. By leveraging rich signals from GPT-4, Orca enhances its capabilities and improves imitation learning performance.

item.description: In this article, we‚Äôll learn to adapt pre-trained models to custom classification tasks using a technique called transfer learning. We will demonstrate it for an image classification task using PyTorc...
item.content:encoded: In this article, we‚Äôll learn to adapt pre-trained models to custom classification tasks using a technique called transfer learning. We will demonstrate it for an image classification task using PyTorch, and compare transfer learning on 3 pre-trained models, Vgg16, ResNet50, and ResNet152.

item.title: RoboCat: A self-improving robotic agent | DeepMind Blog
item.description: Robots are quickly becoming part of our everyday lives, but they‚Äôre often only programmed to perform specific tasks well. While harnessing recent advances in AI could lead to robots that could help in...
item.content:encoded: Robots are quickly becoming part of our everyday lives, but they‚Äôre often only programmed to perform specific tasks well. While harnessing recent advances in AI could lead to robots that could help in many more ways, progress in building general-purpose robots is slower in part because of the time needed to collect real-world training data. Our latest paper introduces a self-improving AI agent for robotics, RoboCat, that learns to perform a variety of tasks across different arms, and then self-g...

item.title: Google at CVPR 2023 | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Shaina Mehta, Program Manager, Google This week marks the beginning of the premier annual Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition conference (CVPR 2023), held in-person in Vancouver, BC ...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Shaina Mehta, Program Manager, Google This week marks the beginning of the premier annual Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition conference (CVPR 2023), held in-person in Vancouver, BC (with additional virtual content). As a leader in computer vision research and a Platinum Sponsor, Google Research will have a strong presence across CVPR 2023 with ~90 papers being presented at the main conference and active involvement in over 40 conference workshops and tutorials.
